title: European Commission Launches Targeted Consultation for EU Space Law
summary:
The European Commission has launched a targeted stakeholder consultation for an EU Space Law that could be adopted in 2024. The creation of an EU Space Law (EUSL) was identified as a priority for the Commission during a 13 September State of the Union address from President Ursula von der Leyen. The legislative proposal envisages […]
The post European Commission Launches Targeted Consultation for EU Space Law appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: China to attempt lunar far side sample return in 2024
summary: China will launch its Chang’e-6 lunar sample return mission next year in an attempt at a first-ever collection of material from the far side of the moon.

title: NASA delays Psyche launch a week
summary: NASA has postponed the launch of the asteroid mission Psyche a week to update the configuration of thrusters on the spacecraft.

title: Rogers Demands Air Force IG Investigation of USSPACECOM HQ Decision
summary: The long simmering feud between the Alabama and Colorado congressional delegations over the location of U.S. Space Command headquarters erupted again today at a House Armed Services Committee hearing. Chairman […]

title: Rogers to continue to challenge decision to keep Space Command in Colorado
summary: he chairman of the House Armed Services Committee Rep. Mike Rogers (R-Ala.) during a hearing Sept. 28 grilled military officials over their role in the Biden administration’s decision to keep U.S. Space Command’s headquarters in Colorado.
